title: Fragments of Music (Frammenti Apollinei)
provenance_text:
Mario Sironi [1885-1961], Italy, until November 1952; purchased by Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1952.

Notes:
[1]. The painting was no. 256 in "The 1952 Pittsburgh International Exhibition of Contemporary Paintings" held at Carnegie Institute, October-December 1952. The museum purchased the painting from the artist from this exhibition. 
The check payable to the artist was forwarded to the Institute's Italian representative on November 28, 1952. The painting was accessioned on December 11, 1952. See copies of correspondence in curatorial file.
